intro: Piperia transversa, commonly known as the transverse piperia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
